description: European Union (EASA) Drone Classification - C0 to C6.

values.description: Weight < 250 g, maximum speed 19 m/s, maximum altitude 120 m AGL, no remote identification required, intended for A1 category operations near people.
Weight < 900 g, must include remote identification and geo-awareness for commercial drones, limited to 120 m AGL, for A1 operations over people with restrictions.
Weight < 2 kg, includes low-speed mode (â‰¤3 m/s) and remote ID, limited to 120 m AGL, usable in A2 (close to people) or A3 (far from people) categories.
Weight < 25 kg, equipped with remote ID, geo-fencing, and flight control limits, limited to 120 m AGL, intended for A3 operations far from people and populated areas.
Weight < 25 kg, no automated flight limitation or geo-awareness required,  limited to 120 m AGL, mainly for professional use or legacy systems in A3 operations.

Weight < 25 kg, compliant with specific safety and fail-safe requirements, includes remote ID, geo-fencing, and link fail management,  limited to 120 m AGL, used for STS-01 operations (BVLOS or urban).

Weight < 25 kg, designed for fixed-wing or VTOL with long-range command link, includes enhanced redundancy and flight termination system,  limited to 120 m AGL, used for STS-02 operations (BVLOS up to 2 km).
